overview_of_class: This courses focuses on the impact of culture on child and adolescent development. As media has become such a ubiquitous part of childhood in the US, much of this course will focus on the effect of media on child development including the impact that television, video games, computers, and touchscreen devices have on child social, emotional, cognitive, and health development. This course will enhance your understanding of child development and media effects. Secondly, during this course you will be encouraged to apply novel, critical thinking skills to interpret academic research articles and put children's media research in a broader, applied context of policy and education.
name: Children's Culture
title: SoC COMM_ST 390-0-20 Children's Culture
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Sophomores, Juniors, and Seniors from every undergraduate school only.
